issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
I wanted to write a sails.js application within Titaninium Studio, but I wanted to be able to debug.  Nodeclipse plugin will let me do that, but it is impossible to install Nodeclipse with node.acs installed b/c there is a mismatch on chromium debugger versions.  I tried removing the node.acs plugins and features to no avail. 

In general it would be helpful to be able to debug ANY node.js file rather than just ones setup for node.acs.

h3. Actual Result
To be able to debug any node.js file

h3. Expected Result
To be able to debug any node.js file
fields.summary: Titaninum Studio and Nodeclipse don't play well: can't debug any node.js file

comments.body:
Hello! 
Can you please provide the exact error message or a screenshot of the issue? 

Best Regards,
Mauro

Ughtry to install bid eclipse before you close something.  A screen shot won't tell you anything, do your job and actually try to install, you'll see a library version issue that you guys should cleanup.
And also I don't care if I can use nod eclipse if there is some way to debug any node file.  Hence a screenshot is meaningless.
